pr_title: GG-29802 [IGNITE-13125] SQL regressions framework: Random query generation

timeline.message: GG-29802 [IGNITE-13125] SQL regressions framework: Random query generation
add ability to run against GG releases

timeline.bodyText:
"the old one" means some specific old version. Seems, you mean "one of previous versions".
So, how old version will be chosen?
Would you please to give a few words on this?
timeline.author: AMashenkov

replies.bodyText: It should be passed as System property. See https://github.com/gridgain/gridgain/pull/1296/files#diff-5d8bc8f077dd7b97c909e7fef5b24756R238
replies.author: korlov42

replies.bodyText: Would you please describe here how to run the test? or refer to sys properties? as it is still unclear how  "old version" is evaluated.
replies.author: AMashenkov

timeline.bodyText: {@true} if base is Ignite, {@false} if it is GG ?
timeline.author: AMashenkov

replies.bodyText: Yep. Will note this in javadoc
replies.author: korlov42

timeline.author: AMashenkov

replies.bodyText:
Have no idea, it's kinda legacy code from Roman. Also it may be artefact of porting from AI codebase.
It's better to get rig of ModelUtils at all =)
replies.author: korlov42

replies.bodyText: Well I've got the answer: the AI has not such method, so if we are wanted to run benchmarks against AI, we have to provide it explicitly
replies.author: korlov42

timeline.author: AMashenkov

timeline.bodyText: Why can't this class be a generic?

replies.bodyText: Think it can, so let's do it
replies.author: korlov42

timeline.bodyText:
Actually this return only "numeric" column.
Let's rename the method to be more specific.
Also, I'd suggest to add "string" column support (or may be some another varlen type) as well.
I'm ok to add new types support within separate ticket.
timeline.author: AMashenkov

replies.bodyText:
Let's rename the method to be more specific

Ok

I'd suggest to add "string" column support

Actually this PR is like MVP for regression test. There are plans to improve generator not only with supporting different types, but with generating more meaningful queries, where conditions not totally random, but generated with regard to the value bounds and logic relations.
replies.author: korlov42
